* "copolymers" are a type of material made by combining two or more different types of monomers. In this context, they are used as a component in the PSCs.

The paragraph mentions a "PCE" which stands for "power conversion efficiency." It is a property of photovoltaic cells and is expressed as a percentage. In this context, the PCE of copolymers with a tandem structure is increasing and has reached a value of 8.62%.

Other terms in the paragraph, such as "tandem structure" and "copolymers," do not refer to material properties but rather to the structure and composition of the materials being studied.
